definitions.definition: Emitting much light ; visually dazzling ; luminous , lucent , radiant .
examples: The sky was remarkably bright and blue on that beautiful summer day.
Could you please dim the light? It’s far too bright .

definitions.definition: Of an object , surface , etc.: reflecting much light; having a high lustre ; gleaming , shiny .
Of a place : not dark ; well-lit .
Of climate or weather : not cloudy or gloomy ; fair ; also, of a period of time , the sky , etc.: characterized by much sunshine and good weather.

subdefinitions.definition: Of a colour : not muted or pale ; bold , brilliant, vivid .
Of an object, surface, etc.: having vivid colour(s); colourful .
examples: The orange and blue walls of the sitting room were much brighter than the dull grey walls of the kitchen.

subdefinitions.definition: Of a musical instrument , sound , or a voice : clearly audible ; clear , resounding , and often high-pitched .
Of a room or other place: having acoustic qualities that tend to cause much echoing or reverberation of sound, particularly at high frequencies .
Of a scent or taste : having an agreeable balance of sweet and sour , often with associations of coolness, freshness, and sometimes aromaticity .
Of a scent or taste : not bland or mild ; bold, sharp , strong .
Of a substance : clear, transparent ; also, pure , unadulterated ; ( specifically ) of wine : free of suspended particles ; not cloudy; fine .

examples: I woke up today feeling so bright that I decided to have a little dance.

subdefinitions.definition: Of the face or eyes , or a smile : showing happiness or hopefulness ; cheerful , lively .
Of a period of history or time: happy, prosperous , successful .
examples: She has a bright future ahead.

subdefinitions.definition: Of an opportunity or outlook : having a reasonable chance of success ; favourable , good.
examples: If he trains hard, his chances of winning the competition are bright .

subdefinitions.definition: Of conversation , writing , etc.: imaginative or sparkling with wit ; clever , witty .
Having a clear, quick intellect ; intelligent .
examples: She’s very bright . She was able to solve the problem without my help.

subdefinitions.definition: Of the eyes: able to see clearly; of eyesight : keen , sharp. Manifest to the mind as light is to the eyes; clear, evident , plain .
Of a rhythm or tempo : lively, upbeat .

definitions.definition: Of a metal object or surface: lacking any protective coating or surface treatment for the prevention of corrosion .

main_definition: Emitting much light ; visually dazzling ; luminous , lucent , radiant .
secondary_definitions: Of an object , surface , etc.: reflecting much light; having a high lustre ; gleaming , shiny .
Of a place : not dark ; well-lit .
Of climate or weather : not cloudy or gloomy ; fair ; also, of a period of time , the sky , etc.: characterized by much sunshine and good weather.
( metallurgy ) Of a metal object or surface: lacking any protective coating or surface treatment for the prevention of corrosion .
